alert.note: Alert for Allen; Beauregard; East Cameron; Evangeline; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry; Upper Vermilion; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 8:29AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cameron, Jefferson Davis, Evangeline, eastern Beauregard, Acadia, eastern Calcasieu, northwestern Vermilion, northwestern St. Landry and Allen Parishes through 900 AM CDT... At 829 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Allen Parish Airport to near Leblanc to near Iowa to near Grand Lake to near Johnsons Bayou. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Sulphur, Crowley, Eunice, Jennings, Oakdale, Ville Platte, Cameron, Westlake, Mamou, Welsh, Iowa, Lake Arthur, Kinder, Basile, Oberlin, Iota, Gueydan, Elton and Mermentau. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 21 and 83. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 49 between mile markers 35 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
